intro: Brachyotum campylanthum, commonly known as the narrow-leaved thistle, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in rocky or arid environments, showcasing its adaptability to harsh conditions. Its leaves are narrow and often covered in fine hairs, while the flowers are yellow and arranged in a compact cluster. Brachyotum campylanthum is known for its medicinal properties and has been used in traditional herbal remedies.
